thread.title: Near everything, but not a full-service hotel. It was great for us, since three were travelling.
thread.title_full: Near everything, but not a full-service hotel. It was great for us, since three were travelling. - Review of Candlewood Suites New York City Times Square, New York City, NY - TripAdvisor

author: dbwbear
title: Near everything, but not a full-service hotel. It was great for us, since three were travelling.
text:
We stayed for 4 nights and were aware of the lack of housekeeping as we have stayed at other Candlewood properties. It is not a full-service hotel (no restaurant, bar, etc.) which was fine for us as we wanted to experience the restaurants, bars and attractions that were near the hotel. We had no problems with water or appliances or the Television although we only watched it in the morning for the weather and news. The kitchenette was great as we brought home leftovers and had our coffee in the room before going out all day. It worked for us and it is probably fine for most people. If you want a view pay $400 a night for a much smaller room. We were on the 32nd floor and never had a problem with the elevator.
Room Tip: We liked upper floor. View did not matter, we were not there much. See more room tips Green Features: It appeared that they were recycling, but unsure of anything else.
